page.title: 06ECOLOGY 03800597
page.content: Being mainly hill land with some forestation the{wild life}is varied. There are two known badger setts in the area. Deer,rabbits,hares and foxes can be found;the fox being a menace to farmers is therefore hunted. The{bird life}covers all categories .eg.moorland, woodland, water and lowland.{Summer visitors}are wheatear, swallows,cuckoo,golden plover wagtails,ring ousels.The{Rede}is a clear, fast flowing stony_bedded river which contains trout and salmon. There are gooseanders, mallards, heron, dippers sandpipers and oyster catchers. The moorhens have declined owing to the increase of mink in the bank. A variety of meadow and marsh {flowers}are found eg; yellow flag and rare early purple orchid also.There are 2 areas of tree{conservation.}
